title: Basic User Data Isolation
description: Two users create tables, enable RLS, insert data - each only sees own data

examples.name: Complete User Isolation Workflow
examples.description: Full end-to-end test of user signup, table creation, RLS setup, and data isolation

workflow.name: Clean up any existing test data
Alice creates posts table
workflow.sql: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS test_posts (id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(), user_id UUID REFERENCES auth.users(id), title TEXT NOT NULL, content TEXT, created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW());

workflow.name: Alice enables RLS on posts table
workflow.sql: DO $$ BEGIN IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM pg_class c JOIN pg_namespace n ON c.relnamespace = n.oid WHERE n.nspname = 'public' AND c.relname = 'test_posts' AND c.relrowsecurity = true) THEN ALTER TABLE test_posts ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY; END IF; END $$;

workflow.name: Drop existing SELECT policy
workflow.sql: DROP POLICY IF EXISTS "Users can view own posts" ON test_posts;

workflow.name: Alice creates SELECT policy
workflow.sql: CREATE POLICY "Users can view own posts" ON test_posts FOR SELECT USING (auth.uid() = user_id);

workflow.name: Drop existing INSERT policy
workflow.sql: DROP POLICY IF EXISTS "Users can create own posts" ON test_posts;

workflow.name: Alice creates INSERT policy
workflow.sql: CREATE POLICY "Users can create own posts" ON test_posts FOR INSERT WITH CHECK (auth.uid() = user_id);

workflow.name: Bob queries posts (should only see his own)
Alice queries posts (should only see her own)

title: Service Role RLS Bypass
description: Service role can see all data regardless of RLS policies

examples.name: Service Role Sees All Data
examples.description: Service role bypasses RLS and sees all user data

workflow.name: Clean up before service role test
Create test_posts table
workflow.sql: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS test_posts (id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(), user_id UUID REFERENCES auth.users(id), title TEXT NOT NULL, content TEXT, created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW());

workflow.name: Enable RLS
workflow.sql: ALTER TABLE test_posts ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;

workflow.name: Drop existing policy
workflow.sql: DROP POLICY IF EXISTS "Users can view own posts" ON test_posts;

workflow.name: Create SELECT policy
workflow.sql: CREATE POLICY "Users can view own posts" ON test_posts FOR SELECT USING (auth.uid() = user_id);

workflow.name: Insert test data for Alice and Bob
workflow.sql: INSERT INTO test_posts (user_id, title, content) VALUES ((SELECT id FROM auth.users WHERE email = 'alice@rlstest.com'), 'Alice Test Post', 'Alice content'), ((SELECT id FROM auth.users WHERE email = 'bob@rlstest.com'), 'Bob Test Post', 'Bob content');

title: Complex RLS Policies
description: Test complex RLS policies with multiple conditions

examples.name: Multi-Condition Policy Test
examples.description: Test policies with multiple conditions and different operations

workflow.name: Create projects table with complex RLS
workflow.sql: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS test_projects (id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(), owner_id UUID REFERENCES auth.users(id), name TEXT NOT NULL, is_public BOOLEAN DEFAULT false, created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW());

workflow.name: Enable RLS on projects
workflow.sql: DO $$ BEGIN IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM pg_class c JOIN pg_namespace n ON c.relnamespace = n.oid WHERE n.nspname = 'public' AND c.relname = 'test_projects' AND c.relrowsecurity = true) THEN ALTER TABLE test_projects ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY; END IF; END $$;

workflow.name: Drop existing projects SELECT policy
workflow.sql: DROP POLICY IF EXISTS "Users see own or public projects" ON test_projects;

workflow.name: Create policy: users see own projects OR public projects
workflow.sql: CREATE POLICY "Users see own or public projects" ON test_projects FOR SELECT USING (auth.uid() = owner_id OR is_public = true);

workflow.name: Drop existing projects INSERT policy
workflow.sql: DROP POLICY IF EXISTS "Users create own projects" ON test_projects;

workflow.name: Create INSERT policy for projects
workflow.sql: CREATE POLICY "Users create own projects" ON test_projects FOR INSERT WITH CHECK (auth.uid() = owner_id);

workflow.name: Bob queries projects (should see his own + Alice's public)

title: UPDATE and DELETE Policy Testing
description: Test RLS policies for UPDATE and DELETE operations

examples.name: Users Can Only Update/Delete Own Data
examples.description: Test that users can only modify their own records

workflow.name: Create test_posts table for UPDATE test
workflow.sql: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS test_posts (id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(), user_id UUID REFERENCES auth.users(id), title TEXT NOT NULL, content TEXT NOT NULL, created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW());

workflow.name: Enable RLS on test_posts
workflow.sql: ALTER TABLE test_posts ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;

workflow.name: Drop existing SELECT policy for posts
workflow.sql: DROP POLICY IF EXISTS "Users can view own posts" ON test_posts;

workflow.name: Create SELECT policy for posts
workflow.sql: CREATE POLICY "Users can view own posts" ON test_posts FOR SELECT USING (auth.uid() = user_id);

workflow.name: Drop existing INSERT policy for posts
workflow.sql: DROP POLICY IF EXISTS "Users can create own posts" ON test_posts;

workflow.name: Create INSERT policy for posts
workflow.sql: CREATE POLICY "Users can create own posts" ON test_posts FOR INSERT WITH CHECK (auth.uid() = user_id);

workflow.name: Sign in as Bob for insert
Sign in as Alice for update test
Drop existing UPDATE policy
workflow.sql: DROP POLICY IF EXISTS "Users update own posts" ON test_posts;

workflow.name: Create UPDATE policy for posts
workflow.sql: CREATE POLICY "Users update own posts" ON test_posts FOR UPDATE USING (auth.uid() = user_id) WITH CHECK (auth.uid() = user_id);

workflow.name: Create DELETE policy for posts
workflow.sql: CREATE POLICY "Users delete own posts" ON test_posts FOR DELETE USING (auth.uid() = user_id);

title: RLS with Table Relations
description: Test RLS behavior with foreign key relationships and joins

examples.name: RLS with Related Tables
examples.description: Test RLS policies work correctly with table relationships

workflow.name: Create comments table
workflow.sql: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS test_comments (id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(), post_id UUID REFERENCES test_posts(id), author_id UUID REFERENCES auth.users(id), content TEXT NOT NULL, created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW());

workflow.name: Enable RLS on comments
workflow.sql: DO $$ BEGIN IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM pg_class c JOIN pg_namespace n ON c.relnamespace = n.oid WHERE n.nspname = 'public' AND c.relname = 'test_comments' AND c.relrowsecurity = true) THEN ALTER TABLE test_comments ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY; END IF; END $$;

workflow.name: Drop existing comments policy
workflow.sql: DROP POLICY IF EXISTS "Users see comments on visible posts" ON test_comments;

workflow.name: Create comment visibility policy
workflow.sql: CREATE POLICY "Users see comments on visible posts" ON test_comments FOR SELECT USING (EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM test_posts WHERE test_posts.id = post_id AND (test_posts.user_id = auth.uid() OR auth.uid() = author_id)));

workflow.name: Ensure Alice has a post to comment on
Alice comments on her own post
workflow.sql: INSERT INTO test_comments (post_id, author_id, content) VALUES ((SELECT id FROM test_posts WHERE title = 'Alice''s First Post' LIMIT 1), (SELECT id FROM auth.users WHERE email = 'alice@rlstest.com'), 'Alice commenting on her own post');

workflow.name: Bob queries comments (should not see Alice's post comments)

title: Policy Conflict Resolution
description: Test how multiple policies interact and resolve conflicts

examples.name: Multiple Policies Same Operation
examples.description: Test behavior when multiple policies apply to same operation

workflow.name: Create documents table
workflow.sql: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS test_documents (id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(), owner_id UUID REFERENCES auth.users(id), department TEXT, is_confidential BOOLEAN DEFAULT false, title TEXT NOT NULL);

workflow.name: Enable RLS on documents
workflow.sql: DO $$ BEGIN IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM pg_class c JOIN pg_namespace n ON c.relnamespace = n.oid WHERE n.nspname = 'public' AND c.relname = 'test_documents' AND c.relrowsecurity = true) THEN ALTER TABLE test_documents ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY; END IF; END $$;

workflow.name: Drop existing owner policy
workflow.sql: DROP POLICY IF EXISTS "owners_see_docs" ON test_documents;

workflow.name: Policy 1: Owners can see their docs
workflow.sql: CREATE POLICY "owners_see_docs" ON test_documents FOR SELECT USING (auth.uid() = owner_id);

workflow.name: Drop existing department policy
workflow.sql: DROP POLICY IF EXISTS "department_see_non_confidential" ON test_documents;

workflow.name: Policy 2: Users can see non-confidential docs in same department
workflow.sql: CREATE POLICY "department_see_non_confidential" ON test_documents FOR SELECT USING (is_confidential = false AND department = (SELECT raw_user_meta_data->>'department' FROM auth.users WHERE id = auth.uid()));

workflow.name: Charlie queries docs (should see Alice's public doc via department policy)
